website_summaries.verdict: One of the few Mac-specific WD hard drives that incorporates the latest USB architecture.
pros: USB-C and USB-A port is designed to work with the Mac platform's Thunderbolt technology
Works with the Time Machine backup software automatically
cons: Included instructions for setting the hard drive up with a Mac computer can be confusing to new users

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded the utilities as instructions described and none of the diagnostic scans worked. Essentially "dead on arrival". I reached out to amazon product support and they immediately processed a return replacement. Amazon Prime is fantastic - best service ever. Hopefully the replacement will work- not feeling very good about it at this point, but thought i would give it a second chance before switching to another brand. Fingers crossed..
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Zoey

customer_reviews.title: Run away from this drive!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst purchases I've ever made. I have a new 2018 Apple MacBook Pro and wanted to use this drive for Time Machine backups. The drive is not plug and play and it has poorly made applications that make it complicated to just use. The drive will back up 1 time and then it will fail every time after that and not automatically back up the computer. You can't eject it from Finder as it says some application (probably one of those unnecessary utilities they install) so you have to Force Quit just to unplug it. This drive does NOT play nice with Macs. Definitely going to return it and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Young

customer_reviews.title: The storage capacity of this device is impressive but the operation of the drive is unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: The storage capacity of this device is impressive for the price but the operation of the drive is unsatisfactory. The drive seems to shutdown if it is left in service when the host laptop goes dormant. The drive appears in Finder but the contents are not listed. The device has to be ejected at the least or the laptop must be shutdown and restarted for the contents of the drive to become visible in Finder and for access. The drive also has preloaded advertisements that continue to pop up even after attempts to remove them from the device.
customer_reviews.author: Old Buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, light weight, and fast
customer_reviews.text: I own four of these and have carried them all over the world to store video and photo files. If you are using a Mac, make sure you order the drive pre-formatted for Mac. I personally recommend them as I have found them to be reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product works flawlessly. I am not sure what Mac problems the one star rather had, but I had no problems. It backs up my MacBook Pro using Time Machine without problems!
customer_reviews.author: Albert W. Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend using a different hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is big and gets very hot when using it, mainly because it can hold a lot of data. In fact, more data than I would ever need. The bad thing about this drive, is that in addition to plugging it into your computer, it also has to be plugged into an outlet, something that most other hard drives don't require.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Stay tuned for updates....
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this HD and one works perfectly. The second one became corrupted and despite several attempts to clean/erase/reformat it still does not work properly. My photo files that take 4 hours to copy to the first drive take over 48 hours to copy to the 2nd one (not sure exactly how long, I gave up after two days. UPDATE #1: I erased this drive once again (4th or 5th time) out of desperation, and this time the files are transferring faster, so I changed from 1 star to 3star review. Not ready to give it any better yet...stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ligett

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Terrific if you want to back up your folder structure - less so if you actually want to backup the files that live within. NEVER worked. Wish there was a 0-star option.
customer_reviews.author: P. Aha

customer_reviews.title: It died and I'm so, so, upset and angry!!! I will never purchase a WD hard drive again!!!
customer_reviews.text: All was well and I save over 100 tv movies, my Mac hard drive, documents, photos, etc. You get the picture. I plugged it in, it loaded and it wouldn't show up. I did first aid on my Mac. Nothing. I've tried all the software programs I could to recover it all for nothing. I'm very careful with my external hard drives as I know they are very sensitive. It's never been dropped or abused. I want Western Digital to pay for me to get my data back! After purchasing 4 ext hard drives from them and two have failed, I will never purchase a WD again. They need to answer to their crappy product!!!
customer_reviews.author: NDS

customer_reviews.title: A very good choice!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as I have a MacBook. It’s very fast. Comes with a regular USB cable and a USB-C cable. This helps with the new MacBooks as you don’t need an adapter. Data transfer speed is great. The price and quality are satisfying! I do really enjoy using this product. Mostly all my data is on this device. It’s lightweight. The WD app helps making a better connection with it. I’ve read a lot of articles and reviews about this product before I purchased it, yet I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Marie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 7 months :(
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was really impressed by this hard drive and I bought it because of the good reviews I saw here. It's password protected and the memory is huge. But after 7 months, my macbook suddenly couldn't recognize the drive anymore. I tried to change cables, installed and uninstalled softwares, but nothing worked. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: NEIL R.

customer_reviews.title: Best so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these now, bought cautiously over the past 2 years, as I work in video, photo and other large files. I have had several external drives by other companies fail, costing me thousands in data recovery costs, and others very balky to mount and stay mounted. I havent put my work on the cloud, yet anyway, for many many reasons, so this is the best company for externals for me so far. But advice: back them up anyway.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last more than a year
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two already- in typical fashion, after 16 months, my MAC can’t detect it. The light is on, I hear spinning, but my drive isn’t being detected. If you would like to have to keep purchasing one of these every year, stay away from this brand. I make sure that this thing is completely safe, it only sits in one spot and has never moved around or disturbed, despite this, it stops working
customer_reviews.author: BaldCats

customer_reviews.title: Appears to function as intended so far
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to set up and appears to function as intended. Of course with that sophisticated testing equipment it's hard to write a review that's not either saying it works great or saying it doesn't work. These products tend to either give perfect service or it's a disaster. Luckily having use dozens of these I will past 20 years I've had no problems that weren't my fault. For example don't drop this and expect it to work LOL
customer_reviews.author: Alan O.

customer_reviews.title: Software won't install
customer_reviews.text: I may be returning this. I'm not sure yet. I'm waiting to hear back from tech support. First off, I had to practically destroy the box to get the drive out of the package. And then the software will not install on Mac OS Mojave. It hangs at 66%. I tried finding the solution on the WD website. Nothing they suggested works. And I found others who posted that they have the exact same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Roehrig

customer_reviews.title: Misleading title - NO USB C ports, must use adapter cable.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hard drive under the assumption that it would have a USB C port, so I wouldn't need to carry one of those stupid adapter cables everywhere I want to access my data. Upon opening the drive I discovered the drive has a single USB MICRO 3.1 port, and not one, but two adapter cables! One for USB C and one for USB A. Awesome. Twice as many cables to lose that are only used for this device. WD dropped the ball on this design, but has another drive for slightly more. It would be great if pictures better illustrated this important difference.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty installing
customer_reviews.text: The My Passport is even more than I needed, Getting it installed and up to date was difficult for me....(not an expert on installations. I would suggest more simplified set=up instructions to be more helpful for users like me.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, easy to convert to NTFS format
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Windows machine since it was cheaper than the Windows equivalent My Passport unit. It was easy to reformat it to NTFS, works like a charm with my Win10 laptop and desktop for backups.
customer_reviews.author: tnmats

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT FAILED!! BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this as an external hard drive for my photos, had it for 8 months when out of the blue it failed on me for no apparent reason. When I contacted customer service they sent me to a 3rd party to fix it - turns out it cannot be fixed. I LOST EVERY BIT OF DATA I HAD ON THAT DRIVE, and it was nearly full.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Schettler

customer_reviews.title: Light burned out but otherwise nice drive
customer_reviews.text: I'm using over USB-A on iMac as a bootable Mojave OS to tun 32-bit apps now that I'm moved to Catalina. The LED light seems to have burned out sometime during the Time Machine transfer while setting this up. I do have trouble booting into Mojave off this about 50% of the time, and I'm not sure if it's too slow over USB-A or what the issue is.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Easy.
customer_reviews.text: I tried a Mac to Mac migration on a $40 Thunderbolt cable from Apple. It did not work. I called Apple. They told me to do it on a Western Digital Passport for Mac. They were right. I transferred info from my old Mac to the WD Passport them from the Passport to my new Mac and everything came out spotless and in the correct order and placement. And now I have the WD Passport as a backup to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Jim

customer_reviews.title: One year later: Worst hard drive I've ever owned (Mac)
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying this is the worst hard drive money can buy, at almost any price. The drive will generally freeze up after a few hours of use and you can only safely unplug the drive by turning off your Mac. In addition to that my Mac also warns me the drive is unreadable every time I plug it in, which makes me believe it is already starting to fail. Just get a different hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great back up drive.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my macbook, 4Tb is enough space for short films shot in 4k, and more than enough for 1080p. It is a great drive albeit not the most durable. But take care with it and it will work great for backing up whatever you need. Price is resonable too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Junco

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play right out of the box. Came preloaded for Apple and makes a great backup drive. Small and compact. Works quickly and doesn't need external power. One cable and you are done.
customer_reviews.author: R. A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Sept of 2018 and it stopped working. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: mascotgirl1

customer_reviews.title: Only drives I trust
customer_reviews.text: Love these drives. Only had an issue once and tech support was quick to replace. Drives are a perfect size for travel and come in an array of colors. I swear by these for work and play. Be sure to buy the case if you plan on using this on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Jannella

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a lot of space
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these drives. One on my older Mac has no issues backing up with Time Machine. The newer Mac has some services running that interferes with the backup. I e yet to troubleshoot what is preventing the automatic backups so for now I manually trigger the backups every few days. Not ideal but I’m certain it’s a software issue on the Mac and not the drive itself.
customer_reviews.author: Techsan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backups
customer_reviews.text: My new MacBook Air has the TB size storage, so I needed a larger backup device - and one that was faster than the older USB 3.0 I was using on the previous Air. The drive plugged in, I told OS X to use it for Time Machine, and away we go. Backups are noticeably faster and test restores work great. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: firewallbillTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded from a standard Passport 3 years old
customer_reviews.text: Functionality as a backup drive is easier to setup and operate. However, I've not found any place where you can specify the number of backups you wish to create as you could with prior passports. May end up calling WD support, as I've not found any type of answer to that issue in FAQ's or online.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and rugged external drive that I use solely for manual backup. I do not use it for time capsule or any other automated backup. For my needs it works great. I have several in different memory sizes and all have worked fine. I did not need or use tech support as it is truly plug and play
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine; access light is on connector side
customer_reviews.text: I personally would like the disk in use light to be on the opposite side, so you can position the drive with the cable connection in the back. Functionally, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: ArtDeco

customer_reviews.title: Slow transfer speed
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have such a small device with a very large capacity to keep an offsite backup of my system. The only downside to this device is it's transfer speed. It's currently chugging along at 0.01GB/s. Yawn...
customer_reviews.author: Verified Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: These drives seem to last a pretty long time.
customer_reviews.text: I use a Mac and I actually like these drives because they seem to have a decently long lifespan. In the 4+ years I've been buying them, none of mine have died on me. Avoid Seagate Backup drives like the plague! Those things will die!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Its not for mac Mojave or Real online storage
customer_reviews.text: Everything now seems to be online, "internet activation required". I needed a drive to backup sensitive info for work. It did a backup on first try and never backed up with Time Machine again. I don't think this is comparable with Mojave. I have backups from another company plug and save, just as I need. Miss leading as is typical today. Just a heads up for anyone. 3 yr warranty but not interested.
customer_reviews.author: ARCHIE

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed to the fact that I paid for this HD 117 and then ahead to pay Experimac 53$ to have it formatted correctly because it didn’t work
customer_reviews.author: melody stuart

customer_reviews.title: These drive have not failed me yet.
customer_reviews.text: These drive have not failed me yet. This is now the fourth one I have gotten to expand my LR catalog. I will be happy when they come out with a larger self powering USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime & Chad Sucher

customer_reviews.title: This is not USB-C.  This is USB-B-Micro-10 pin.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this drive hoping I'd be able to evade using the strange esoteric USB format that plagues most external drives. It seems that this one contains only a cable going from USB-C to USB-B-Micro-10 pin. This would have prevented my purchase outright if I'd noticed. The onus is on me for assuming that "USB-C/USB-A" means USB-C, but I feel like perhaps the title is a fair bit misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Catrambone

customer_reviews.title: Huge storage. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The 4 TB HD arrived on time, and as described. It was very easy to link with my computer and other hard drives. Fast file transfers. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: Easy and useful
customer_reviews.text: I formatted the drive into two equal partitions and use one for time machine the other for additional backup and storage. It works. Only time will tell if it is long term reliable, but so far it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Ellerbruch

customer_reviews.title: Great backup drive plus room for more stuff
customer_reviews.text: Fast, awesome storage capacity. Use mostly for auto backups for my MacBook Pro. Seems flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive, Don't use the built in Software
customer_reviews.text: Drive works fine on my 2018 MacBook Pro. However, one word to the wise. Don't use the the built in software if you have a MAC. I did that and the drive become unusable. Had to reformat it with my Mac software. Now the drive works fine. I use it with Apple's Time Machine software.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: STONE RELIABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this drive as my Time Machine back up drive on my iMac and for the last few months it has been a stalwart of a drive. Plus, it comes in colors so I can easily identify between drives for other applications. Plus, the design is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. 44

customer_reviews.title: Wish it would repair and erase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October as I am graphic design student and needed the extra storage. it worked great until now. It is sayin that it can't be mounted to my MacBook because it is full and there is no way I used all the space on it. I have tried to erase it and it will not allow me too. I am completely frustrated as I am trying to get my homework finished and this external hard drive is not working.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlinda

customer_reviews.title: DIED AFTER 4 MONTHS - LOST EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: ***WARNING - DO NOT BUY** Bought in June and 4 months later it died taking ALL of my photos with it. Now I have to spend $1000 for data recovery - IF they can get anything. Looking into cloud storage. Had an old Hitachi that is still going strong 10 years later, but ran out of room. Passport was the biggest mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Koch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and compact
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had any issues yet. I connected it to my Mac and it automatically popped up to use as time machine, which I immediately set-up for automatic back-up. It’s super compact to. Would recommend to anyone with a Mac looking for an easy solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a good deal if you can get it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for windows. Works great and a good deal if you can get it. Just reformat and bang it works. A quick google search should be able to help you go through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Plug, play, and never run out of space
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 2T model as I do a lot of photo editing and those files can get pretty large. Essentially just plug it in and you're all set.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Krasner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in April 2019 and have stored all of my SOOC photography client data on this. Now it’s December 2019 and the drive has failed! I have two weddings on this drive that are unedited. I am shattered.
customer_reviews.author: Antonina Herrst

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a back up for all my photos on my Mac desktop. It was easy to use, just plugged it in and copied over 40K images. I can't say anything about the speed as that is not issue for me, but it is performing well to suit my needs. I have had it now for over a month and haven't had any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: TO USE IT ON WINDOWS
customer_reviews.text: The drive contains the driver that needed to be installed on Mac/Win by default. And my PC cannot automatically install the driver by itself. So what I did is plug it into iPad and read the driver, share it to my PC and install it. This will install the WD Discovery software, then PC will recognize the My Passport. So another suggestion is directly searching for WD Discovery and install that.
customer_reviews.author: Lingqiu

customer_reviews.title: External Backup
customer_reviews.text: This item was extremely easy to install, perhaps though, only because I had an older one for my 2011 MacBook Pro. The older passport did not function with my new 2018 version so I had to purchase a new backup drive. It was instantly recognized and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Aline

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have two others at the house; one for movies and one for music. Both are connected to my Smart LG. This one is for the family server as a backup. Very good product. I need for customer support. The Amazon chosen delivery company here in PA leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: included cable does not fit standard ports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this "Passport for Mac" because I have a Mac....and it says "Time-Machine ready" so I assumed it was ready to be plugged into my MacBook to be used as a Time-Machine - but the cable included does not fit any port on my laptop. (I've bought several versions of these in the past with no issues.) In some comments I've seen discussion about the adapter cable...that's not ideal, but doesn't matter anyway because mine didn't include an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA

customer_reviews.title: didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April 2019 and it is now November 2019 and it says it is out of date and can't update.
customer_reviews.author: debbief

customer_reviews.title: Failed completely after less than six month
customer_reviews.text: Always a bit slow it failed so completely that could not even access the drive to reformat it with Disk Utility on a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Ban Gulong

customer_reviews.title: Working great on MacBook Pro 2017 with 2 partitions in different format
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this hard drive. It comes with 2 cables, one with USB A and the other with USB C. It's a very nice touch. I've partitioned the disk into 2 partitions. One for Time Machine (format Mac OS Extended) and the other for movies, TV Shows, etc (format ExFAT). It's working perfectly ! The disk is quiet small for the size of storage, which is good for a portable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, easy to use, works right out of the box. Formatted for Mac. Perfect external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: miaoby

customer_reviews.title: Works great for PS4
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because the 4 of us had ran out of room on the PS4. It was recommenced to me and was a great price. Easy to install and move all the info over. Hopefully it will be super hard for them to fill this up!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Warman

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact, and exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I had 4 different external hard drives and I was in need of a new one with USB-C connection. This hard drive was perfect. It's fast and very compact. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rola Hamade

customer_reviews.title: Beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Super easy to install literally connect USB and done. I do video editing and backing up high resolution files and software cache and it is hanging with all the pressure. Works fast and amazing! Small package for a lot a lot of storage. Wouldn’t trade for any other brand. The reviews are accurate on this one! Get one and see for yourself!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Perez

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to use, but user manual is hard to read and only gives general info. Website support is only OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve already used 1/3 of the cap. With the correct format you can easily switch between windows and Mac. Comes with usb-c and standard usb connectors.
customer_reviews.author: N. E. Humphrey III

customer_reviews.title: A handy portable drive
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Time Machine on my mac. It was simply plug, install software, and leave alone! Great product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked right away. Took it out the box and plugged it in my MacBook Pro 2018 and I had no issues as all! Super happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzmine

customer_reviews.title: For the Video Editor
customer_reviews.text: This drive was run on Adobe Premiere and handled the rendering perfectly. It is very quick and compact. The only downside is the surface can scratch easily, but that is a good indicator you are being too rough with it.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy stops working

customer_reviews.title: Never had any issues. Great storage solution!
customer_reviews.text: Never had any problems. I buy this same storage every time. I’m a photographer and videographer. Highly recommend this to anyone.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the new Mac with USB-C port.
customer_reviews.text: Great to just plug straight into my Mac and not need the adaptor to convert USB to USB-C
customer_reviews.author: Larn

customer_reviews.title: Works great

customer_reviews.title: "Plug and play"
customer_reviews.text: The WD 4TB My Passport for Mac is an excellent, well made external hard drive. It is great that WD includes both necessary Mac cables in the box. I use this hard drive as an additional backup for my large camera RAW files. I also take it with me when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Charles Koch

customer_reviews.title: Plug in and Ready to Use
customer_reviews.text: Love this device. Plugged it in brought up Time Machine for my Mac and started backing up my computer. No drivers, no complicated steps, just Plug and Use. Great product.

customer_reviews.title: Good device for the price paid.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T PURCHASE! ITS NOT 4TB.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this due to the space information of 4TB and when we received it, they provided a fraud/false advertisement. It only had 1.64 TB. This is so frustrating to get these things and yet their not what it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Yu-mi & Valentin Diakonu

customer_reviews.title: Came formatted for Windows
customer_reviews.text: Although I ordered a hard drive for Mac, it cam formatted for Windows. After checking with customer support, I was assured I could reformat it and still be able to return it. It works now, but took me an extra 30 minutes to get working.

customer_reviews.title: Already formatted for Mac OSX
customer_reviews.text: Using for Time Machine on my Mac Mini. Works perfectly

customer_reviews.text: great HD, i totally recommend it! it came with regular USB and usb C cable. great value, lots of space, good compact size, good for traveling.

customer_reviews.title: Failed Backup

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the WD 4TB My Passport for my new iMac. I partitioned it into two partitions, one for Time Machine backups and one for storing movies. It works perfect.
